intro: Tapinostemma gibberulum, commonly known as the woolly burr. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
